technologies.name: Bump
technologies.description: Bump is an API contract management platform that helps document and track APIs by identifying changes in API structure, and keeping developers informed through an elegant documentation.

technologies.name: Ruby
technologies.description: Ruby is an open-source object-oriented programming language.

technologies.name: Ruby on Rails
technologies.description: Ruby on Rails is a server-side web application framework written in Ruby under the MIT License.

technologies.name: Stimulus
technologies.description: A modest JavaScript framework for the HTML you already have.

technologies.name: Heroku
technologies.description: Heroku is a cloud platform as a service (PaaS) supporting several programming languages.

technologies.name: Turbo
technologies.description: Turbo is a JavaScript framework for building fast web applications.

technologies.name: Fathom
technologies.description: Fathom is easy-yet-powerful website analytics that protects digital privacy.

technologies.name: core-js
technologies.description: core-js is a modular standard library for JavaScript, with polyfills for cutting-edge ECMAScript features.

technologies.name: HSTS
technologies.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS.

technologies.name: Cloudflare
technologies.description: Cloudflare is a web-infrastructure and website-security company, providing content-delivery-network services, DDoS mitigation, Internet security, and distributed domain-name-server services.

technologies.name: Webpack
technologies.description: Webpack is an open-source JavaScript module bundler.

technologies.name: PWA
technologies.description: Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) are web apps built and enhanced with modern APIs to deliver enhanced capabilities, reliability, and installability while reaching anyone, anywhere, on any device, all with a single codebase.

technologies.name: Open Graph
technologies.description: Open Graph is a protocol that is used to integrate any web page into the social graph.

info.name: DNS SaaS Service Detection
author: noah @thesubtlety
pdteam
info.description: A CNAME DNS record was discovered

info.name: CAA Record
author: pdteam
info.description: A CAA record was discovered. A CAA record is used to specify which certificate authorities (CAs) are allowed to issue certificates for a domain.

info.name: DOM EventListener - Cross-Site Scripting
author: yavolo
dwisiswant0
info.description: EventListener contains a cross-site scripting vulnerability via the document object model (DOM). An attacker can execute arbitrary script which can then allow theft of cookie-based authentication credentials and launch of  other attacks.

nuclei.curl-command: curl -X 'POST' -d '_=<script>alert(1)</script>' -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' -H 'Host: tech.covoiturage.beta.gouv.fr' -H 'User-Agent: Nuclei - Open-source project (github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei)' 'https://tech.covoiturage.beta.gouv.fr/'

info.name: Detect SSL Certificate Issuer
author: lingtren
info.description: Extract the issuer's organization from the target's certificate. Issuers are entities which sign and distribute certificates.

info.name: SSL DNS Names
author: pdteam
info.description: Extract the Subject Alternative Name (SAN) from the target's certificate. SAN facilitates the usage of additional hostnames with the same certificate.

info.name: Deprecated TLS Detection
author: righettod
forgedhallpass
info.description: Both TLS 1.1 and SSLv3 are deprecated in favor of stronger encryption.
info.remediation: Update the web server's TLS configuration to disable TLS 1.1 and SSLv3.

info.name: Deprecated TLS Detection
author: righettod
forgedhallpass
info.description: Both TLS 1.1 and SSLv3 are deprecated in favor of stronger encryption.
info.remediation: Update the web server's TLS configuration to disable TLS 1.1 and SSLv3.

info.name: TLS Version - Detect
author: pdteam
pussycat0x
info.description:
TLS version detection is a security process used to determine the version of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol used by a computer or server.
It is important to detect the TLS version in order to ensure secure communication between two computers or servers.

info.name: TLS Version - Detect
author: pdteam
pussycat0x
info.description:

info.name: Weak Cipher Suites Detection
author: pussycat0x
info.description: A weak cipher is defined as an encryption/decryption algorithm that uses a key of insufficient length. Using an insufficient length for a key in an encryption/decryption algorithm opens up the possibility (or probability) that the encryption scheme could be broken.

info.name: Weak Cipher Suites Detection
author: pussycat0x
info.description: A weak cipher is defined as an encryption/decryption algorithm that uses a key of insufficient length. Using an insufficient length for a key in an encryption/decryption algorithm opens up the possibility (or probability) that the encryption scheme could be broken.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.
accessibility.manualDescription: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review).

seo.title: SEO
seo.description: These checks ensure that your page is following basic search engine optimization advice. There are many additional factors Lighthouse does not score here that may affect your search ranking, including performance on [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/learn-web-vitals/). [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).
seo.manualDescription: Run these additional validators on your site to check additional SEO best practices.

pwa.title: PWA
pwa.description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist).
pwa.manualDescription: These checks are required by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist) but are not automatically checked by Lighthouse. They do not affect your score but it's important that you verify them manually.
